Apple Rises to Take Over as Top-Performing Dow Stock
By Paul Ausick October 6, 2018 8:45 am EDT
$AAPL  After three weeks as an also-ran, Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) returns as the Dow Jones
$AAPL  industrial average’s best-performing stock for the year to date
The United States Department of Homeland Security has added to the growing chorus of voices siding with $AAPL & Amazon vs Bloomberg report

Apple Rises to Take Over as Top-Performing Dow Stock

$MSFT $AAPL $V $NKE $DJIA $BA

links.title: Apple Rises to Take Over as Top-Performing Dow Stock
links.description: After three weeks as an also-ran, Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) returns as the Dow Jones industrial average's best-performing stock for the year to date. Even though the company's shares lost about 0.6% last week, the world's most valuable company has still managed to post a year-to-date share price gain of 32.5%.

links.title: Tesla Model 3 Total Cost of Ownership Estimate - Crushing It
links.description: For another article I am writing, I needed a good tool for estimating vehicle total cost of ownership (TCO), something that I could easily use to compare any cars out there. I didn't want to develop all my numbers from my experience, since then I would have to research every other car that someone wanted to compare it to.

links.description: Andrew Harrer | Bloomberg | Getty Images The U.S. Department of Homeland Security said on Saturday it currently had no reason to doubt statements from companies that have denied a Bloomberg report that their supply chains were compromised by malicious computer chips inserted by Chinese intelligence services.
